title: In Sydney Suburb Where Suspects Lived, Neighbor Saw ‘No Dramas’
summary: He said the people in the house were relatively new to the area and largely kept to themselves.

title: At a Dark Moment, Jews in New York Celebrate the Festival of Lights
summary: After the mass shooting at a Hanukkah celebration in Sydney, Australia, Jewish New Yorkers said they felt the need to stand up for their community.

title: Ahmed el Ahmed, Who Tackled One of the Bondi Beach Gunmen, Is Recovering in a Hospital
summary: Video of Ahmed el Ahmed disarming one of the gunmen has gone viral, and officials around the world have hailed his bravery.

title: Nick Reiner’s Struggles With Drugs Left His Parents ‘Desperate’
summary: Mr. Reiner, who was arrested in connection with the deaths of Rob and Michele Reiner, once estimated he had been in drug treatment 18 times as a teenager.

title: Trump’s Post Attacking Rob Reiner After Stabbing Death Draws Immediate Outrage
summary: The president attributed the killing to “Trump derangement syndrome,” but his disparaging comments drew backlash even from conservative allies who said they were inappropriate.

title: Rob Reiner Made Clear What He Believed In, Onscreen and Off
summary: In films like “A Few Good Men,” the director’s ideas of honor and morality were stated as plainly as could be.

title: FBI Director Kash Patel, Eager for Spotlight, Casts Aside Caution in Social Media Posts
summary: Kash Patel’s impulse to publicize the work of the bureau under his leadership has revived questions about his competence and his future in the administration.

title: Kushner’s Firm Pulls Out of Trump-Branded Hotel Deal in Serbia
summary: The announcement came just hours after prosecutors there charged four government officials with corruption in connection with the half-billion-dollar project.

title: Donald Trump Jr. Is Engaged to Bettina Anderson, a Palm Beach Socialite
summary: The relationship between the president’s son and Ms. Anderson had been the subject of tabloid speculation during his previous engagement to Kimberly Guilfoyle.

title: Trump Files $10 Billion Suit Over BBC Documentary
summary: The British broadcaster, which has expressed regret over the editing of video clips about the president, has rejected claims that the error was evidence of a fundamental bias in its news reporting.

title: Volkswagen to End Production at German Plant, a First in Company History
summary: The auto giant stopped making cars at the plant in Dresden, which opened in 2001, as it faces weaker demand and steep U.S. tariffs.

title: Ford Will Take $19.5 Billion Hit as It Rolls Back E.V. Plans
summary: Ford Motor said the costs came from its decision to make fewer electric vehicles than it had planned and more hybrids that use both gasoline engines and batteries.

title: Pelosi Long Resisted Stock-Trading Ban for Congress, Fueling Suspicion
summary: The former speaker failed to appreciate the groundswell of support for banning the practice, refusing to give an inch amid G.O.P. accusations that she was corrupt.

title: Anthony Geary, Luke on ‘General Hospital,’ Dies at 78
summary: Portraying Luke Spencer, he was one of the best-known soap opera stars in American television. His onscreen romance with Laura Webber, played by Genie Francis, changed the landscape of daytime television.

title: The 52 Best Breakup Lines (Said in Real Life)
summary: To mark the winter holidays — an especially popular time to break up — we asked people around the world for their most striking parting words to each other.

title: Joe Ely, Texas-Born Troubadour of the Open Road, Dies at 78
summary: Thanks to his eclectic style and tireless touring, he was among the most influential artists in the early days of Americana and alt-country music.

title: Europe Is in Decline. Good.
summary: Demotion need not be traumatic.

title: 600 Readers Told Us About the Best Gifts They Ever Got. These Are the Top 13.
summary: We asked readers to tell us about the most memorable presents they’ve received.

title: Ukraine and Allies Agree on Security Guarantee for Peace Proposal
summary: Crucial details on the future security of Ukraine remain unsettled as negotiators seek a deal that Russia will approve.

title: Robert Samuelson, Award-Winning Economics Columnist, Dies at 79
summary: He was a familiar byline in Newsweek and The Washington Post for decades, explaining the intricacies of economic policy in reader-friendly vernacular.

title: U.S. Soldiers and Translator Killed in Syria Are Identified
summary: The shooting attack in Palmyra, Syria, on Saturday struck Iowa National Guard troops. Two were killed, along with an American civilian interpreter; three others were wounded.

title: How the Pandemic Lockdowns Changed a Songbird’s Beak
summary: For ecologists, the Covid-19 pandemic has presented a remarkable natural experiment in what can happen to wild animals when humans stay home.
